title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.185 - Executive Order No. 185: Establishing the 2023 World University Games Commission and Reflecting the State's Support of the Games
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.185 - Executive Order No. 185: Establishing the 2023 World University Games Commission and Reflecting the State's Support of the Games

State Regulations
WHEREAS, international sport and world class athletics in

New York State brings great value and historical pride to the State in
welcoming all nations and participating in such events; WHEREAS, the State has long supported the development of
the tourism industry throughout the State and, more specifically, has continued
to support tourism growth across the North Country; WHEREAS, in 2016, nearly 12 million people visited the

Adirondack region "" 250,000 more visitors than the previous year, generating
nearly $1.35 billion in direct visitor spending; WHEREAS, the World University Games (the "Games"), organized by International University Sports Federation ("FISU"), is an
international sports and cultural event staged every two years in a different
city and country and is the largest global winter multi-sports event for
student athletes; WHEREAS, FISU, an international non-profit association
founded in 1949 within universities, promotes sporting values and encourages
top performances in international competitions in harmony with and
complementary to the values of higher education; WHEREAS, the 11-day competition draws over 2,400
student-athletes together to compete in various disciplines including alpine, freestyle and cross-country skiing, biathlon, speed skating, curling, figure
skating, hockey, short track speed skating, snowboarding, and more; WHEREAS, representatives from the State, the Village of

Lake Placid (the "Village"), and the Adirondack North Country Sports Council, submitted a bid to become host of the 2023 World University Games and on March
5, 2018, FISU selected the Village as the host city for the Games; WHEREAS, this will be the second time Lake Placid has
hosted the Games, the first time being in 1972, and the third time New York

State has hosted, with Buffalo hosting in 1993. The Games have never been
hosted by another state in the United States; WHEREAS, hosting the 2023 World University Games in the

Village will result in substantial development and redevelopment in the State, the North Country region, and more specifically, in the Village, which will
lead to an unprecedented number of visitors to experience the Village and its
many cultural, historic and recreational opportunities, thereby greatly
stimulating the economy in both the Village and the State; WHEREAS, hosting an international competition of this
magnitude and scale will require involvement of the region, participation of
multiple state agencies and authorities, partnering with the State University
of New York and private colleges and universities for sports venues and
volunteers, using sports venues managed by the New York State Olympic Regional

Development Authority and regional hospitality facilities and venues in Saranac

Lake, Wilmington, and more; and
WHEREAS, the closest possible coordination between the

State, the Village, local elected officials, and community groups will be
required to support the success of the event and the State wants to support the

Games in a manner that ensures that the event is organized in the best possible
manner and under the best possible conditions for the benefit of the world
university sports movement; and
NOW, THEREFORE, I, ANDREW M. CUOMO, by virtue of the
authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State of New York, do hereby establish the New York State World University Games Commission to
develop and implement a plan to support the successful implementation of the
2023 World University Games. I. Membership

The members of New York State World University Games

Commission ("Commission") shall include the Chancellor of the State University
of New York, or his or her designee, the Commissioner of the Department of

Transportation or his or her designee, the Commissioner of Environmental

Conservation, or his or her designee, the Commissioner of General Services, or
his or her designee, the Commissioner of the Office of Parks, Recreation and

Historic Preservation or his or her designee, the President and Chief Executive

Officer of the New York State Urban Development Corporation, or his or her
designee, the Superintendent of the State Police, or his or her designee, the

Commissioner of the New York State Division of Homeland Security and Emergency

Services, or his or her designee, the President and Chief Executive Officer of
the New York State Olympic Regional Development Authority, or his or her
designee, the Director of the Division of the Budget, or his or her designee, and any additional members as appointed by the Governor, who shall serve at the
pleasure of the Governor. The Governor shall designate a Chairperson of the

Commission from among the members of the Commission. The members of the

Commission shall receive no compensation but shall be entitled to reimbursement
for any reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in connection with the
performance of their duties. Service on the Commission shall not constitute
public employment for purposes of disqualification from holding public office
or employment. II. Responsibilities and Powers

The Commission shall be responsible for providing oversight
and coordination of all efforts of State government with respect to both to
bringing the 2023 World University Games to the Village of Lake Placid and
working with the Organizing Committee in the planning and implementation of the
2023 World University Games. In this regard, the Commission is charged with the
following duties: 1. to coordinate the

State"TMs involvement in preparing for, organizing and providing assistance to
the efforts of World University Games Organizing Committee for the 2023 World

University Games; 2. to coordinate
the State"TMs efforts in obtaining, preparing for, organizing and providing
facilities and other public improvements and the necessary public services for
the 2023 World University Games, and to promote the success of such

Games; 3. to work in cooperation
with and assist the Village, the Organizing Committee and FISU and all relevant
units of government to accomplish the purposes of the Commission as set out in
this Order; 4. with respect to
security, to identify all appropriate and necessary measures in order to ensure
the safe and peaceful celebration of the 2023 World University Games, including
the financial, planning and operational aspects related thereto; and
5. to consult with the Village, the

Organizing Committee and FISU regarding the preparation of security for the
2023 World University Games including responding to any specific questions
raised to the extent that the release of such information will not pose a
threat to security protocols. III. Cooperation of Other State Agencies and

Entities

Each agency, department, office, division, and public
authority of this State is hereby required to cooperate with the Commission and
to furnish the Commission with such information, personnel, and assistance as
may be permitted by law in furtherance of accomplishing the purposes of this

Order. Notes
